xxl.core.relational.cursors

Class Aggregator

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<A>
      • xxl.core.cursors.mappers.Aggregator<Tuple,Tuple>
        • xxl.core.relational.cursors.Aggregator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

    public class Aggregator
extends Aggregator<Tuple,Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
    The aggregator computes aggregates like SUM, COUNT and VARIANCE for an input metadata cursor. This aggregator is based on the implementation of Aggregator.

    Some standard aggregates are defined in this class, but new functionality can simply be included by using your own MetaDataFunction.

    Important: an aggregator executes no group- or sort-operations! For this task a group-aggreagtion should be used.

    See Also:
    GroupAggregator

    • Field Detail

      • COUNT

        public static final MetaDataAggregationFunction<Object,Long,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> COUNT
        A metadata aggregate that can be used as aggregate function to compute the count-aggregate. The column name is set to COUNT and its precision is 20.

      • COUNT_ALL

        public static final MetaDataAggregationFunction<Object,Long,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> COUNT_ALL
        A metadata aggregate that can be used as aggregate function to compute the countAll-aggregate. The column name is set to COUNT_ALL and its precision is 20.

        public static final MetaDataAggregationFunction<Number,Number,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> SUM

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aggregator

        public Aggregator(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                  MetaDataAggregationFunction<Tuple,Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>[] aggregates,
                  String[] aggregateColumnNames,
                  int[] projectedColumns,
                  Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createOutputTuple)
        Creates a new aggregator.
        Parameters:
        cursor - the metadata cursor delivering the input elements.
        aggregates - an array of metadata aggregates that each computes an aggregate on the input data.
        aggregateColumnNames - the column names of the aggregate columns. This array must have the same length as the number of given aggregates. If an entry equals null, the name determined by the aggregate function is taken.
        projectedColumns - the columns to which the input metadata cursor is projected.
        createOutputTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) and a to a new result Tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used as a default factory method.

      • Aggregator

        public Aggregator(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                  MetaDataAggregationFunction<Object,Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>[] aggregates,
                  int[] aggregatedColumns,
                  String[] aggregateColumnNames,
                  int[] projectedColumns,
                  Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createOutputTuple)
        Creates a new aggregator.
        Parameters:
        cursor - the metadata cursor delivering the input elements.
        aggregates - an array of metadata aggregates that each computes an aggregate on the input data.
        aggregatedColumns - the column indices determining which aggregate function is applied on which column. This array must have the same length as the number of given aggregates.
        aggregateColumnNames - the column names of the aggregate columns. This array must have the same length as the number of given aggregates. If an entry equals null, the name determined by the aggregate function is taken.
        projectedColumns - the columns to which the input metadata cursor is projected.
        createOutputTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) and a to a new result Tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used as a default factory method.

        public Aggregator(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                  MetaDataAggregationFunction<Tuple,Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>[] aggregates,
                  int[] projectedColumns,
                  Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createOutputTuple)
        Creates a new aggregator. The column names of the aggregates are determined by the aggregate functions.
        Parameters:
        cursor - the metadata cursor delivering the input elements.
        aggregates - an array of metadata aggregates that each computes an aggregate on the input data.
        projectedColumns - the columns to which the input metadata cursor is projected.

                  int[] projectedColumns,
                  Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createOutputTuple)
        Creates a new aggregator.
        Parameters:
        resultSet - the result set delivering the input elements. It is wrapped internally to a metadata cursor (ResultSetMetaDataCursor).

    • Method Detail

      • getTupleAggregationFunctions

        protected static MetaDataAggregationFunction<Tuple,Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>[] getTupleAggregationFunctions(MetaDataAggregationFunction<Object,Object,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>[] aggregates,
                                                                                                                           int[] aggregatedColumns)
        Composes every aggregation function specified in the given array with a function that projects an input tuple to the value of the column specified by the given int array.
        Parameters:
        aggregates - an array of aggregation functions that are not able to process tuples.
        aggregatedColumns - an array holding the indices of the columns that should be used as arguments of specified aggregation functions.
        Returns:
        an array of aggregation functions that are able to process tuples. When the n-th returned aggregation function is invoked with an input tuple, the tuple is projected to its n-th specified column and the n-th specified aggregation function is invoked with it.

      • getMetaData

        public CompositeMetaData<Object,Object> getMetaData()
        Returns the metadata information for this metadata-cursor as a composite metadata (CompositeMetaData).
        Specified by:
        getMetaData in interface MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
        Specified by:
        getMetaData in interface MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
        Returns:
        the metadata information for this metadata-cursor as a composite metadata (CompositeMetaData).
